cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles SW of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn WNW then NW into the southeast Gulf of Mexico, curve NE across the Florida Big Bend, and track northeastward along/near the Georgia–South Carolina coast before moving offshore of the Carolinas.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Apalachee Bay)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coastline from the Florida Big Bend northeastward through Georgia and the South and North Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) possible Friday with a cumulative probability up to 12%.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding of 1–3 ft above ground level possible if the storm center hugs the coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain possible Friday with localized totals of 2–4 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas and dangerous rip currents affecting vessel approaches and berthing.
